reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: FLC: Yusudi 2020 - 2021 Employability of TVET graduates through the use of a slaes apprenticeship training

description.narrative: An innovative training and apprenticeship program undertaken with a grand ambition to increase the employability of graduates by increasing their work experience and job relevant skills. The project will complement and replace the often standardized and ou tdated learning methods for skills development; to enable a practical focused growth of skills starting with growing sales skills. Those youth won't just be good sales people they will be confident they will have resilience they will be opportunistic they will be determined. Sales skills are a means to income but it's also a means to a different future. The project will build Africa?s next generation of youth workforce equipped with skills and mindsets for success. In 2020-2021The project will be focused on serving the unemployed and underemployed youth (18-30 years old) primarily from lower middle-income class in Kenya who are looking to develop or diversify their practical skills to start a career. The goal is to increase employability of young graduates from TVET institutions through the use of a sales apprenticeship sales training facility. This will lead us to achieve two separate outcomes: 1.Employability skills increase among youth 2.Economic growth through increased labour productivity in sales and business development among SMEs
